section.p: Surgical operation or procedure, especially one involving the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue.

ol.li: Extends Clinical Service

Contains exactly one [1..1] id with data type Id
Unique Identifier for this surgical event.

Contains exactly one [1..1] isNonORSurgicalProcedure with data type Boolean
Indicates whether the case is a non surgical event. Like values are yes, no

Contains exactly one [1..1] preOpInrDate with data type Point In Time
This is the date that the preoperative INR was performed.

Contains exactly one [1..1] severityLevel with data type Code
Codes that identify the degree of severity of the surgical procedure.

Contains exactly one [1..1] status with data type Code
The value specifying the state of this patient surgical encounter (based on the RIM Act class state machine), for example, active, aborted, completed

Contains exactly one [1..1] supervisionLevel with data type Code
Indicates the highest level of supervision of the anesthesiology staff supervisor. Suggested include Staff Assisting Resident.

Contains exactly one [1..1] surgeryDuration with data type Time Interval
Contains the duration (date/time) of the Surgical Event.

Contains exactly one [1..1] surgeryType with data type Code
Contains Code Set that identifies the type of Surgery. like Heart, Onocology.

Contains at least one [1..*] anesthesia, where its type is Anesthesia Event
The loss of sensation and usually of consciousness without loss of vital functions artificially produced by the administration of one or more agents that block the passage of pain impulses along nerve pathways to the brain Source: Merriam-Webster's Medical Dictionary, 2002 Merriam-Webster, Inc.

Contains zero or more [0..*] assessment, where its type is Surgery Assessment
A test or instrument, often a questionaire, used to evaluate or assess the patient's health, within the context of the surgical event.
Contains exactly one [1..1] attender, where its type is Attender

Contains at least one [1..*] bodyFluid, where its type is Bodily Fluid Administration
The liquid parts of the body

Contains at least one [1..*] cellSaver, where its type is Cell Saver Event
Cell Saver for the surgical event

Contains zero or more [0..*] comments, where its type is Comment Event
Contains general comments regarding the Surigcal event.

Contains zero or more [0..*] concurrentCase, where its type is Surgical Event
The current surgical event for the Patient.

Contains at least one [1..*] device, where its type is Surgery Device
A piece of equipment and or a mechanism designed to serve a special purpose or perform a special function. This class represents devices used to perform a surgery, such as lasers, as well as devices that might be implanted in the patient as a result of the surgery, such as a prosthesis or a stent.

Contains zero or more [0..*] electrodePosition, where its type is Electrode Position Procedure
Identifies a position corresponding to the area of placement of the dispersive electrode pad.

Contains zero or more [0..*] equipmentMeasurement, where its type is Equipment Measurement Event
The dimension, quantity, or capacity determined by measuring a peice of equipment.

Contains zero or more [0..*] equipmentSterilization, where its type is Equipment Sterilization Event
Sterliizes the equipment and provides the sterilization number of the implanted device

Contains zero or more [0..*] equipmentUtilization, where its type is Equipment Utilization Observation
Contains the Date and time and durationthe piece of Equipment was in use.

Contains exactly one [1..1] fluidAudit, where its type is Fluid Audit
A methodical examination or review of the fluid utilized in the surgical event.

Contains exactly one [1..1] function, where its type is Surgeon Function
Assigned duty or activity performed by the medical specialist who performs surgery :

Contains at least one [1..*] image, where its type is Radiology Promise
Identifies the image.

Contains at least one [1..*] irrigation, where its type is Irrigation Event
cleaning a wound or body organ by flushing or washing out with water or a medicated solution

Contains at least one [1..*] labRequest, where its type is Lab Test Request
Request for lab tests to be performed

Contains exactly one [1..1] location, where its type is Service Delivery Location
Defines the location ward room, and service organization for the surgical event.

Contains zero or one [0..1] medicalSpecialty, where its type is Medical Specialty
Identifies the medical specialty credited for doing this non-OR procedure.

Contains zero or more [0..*] occurrence, where its type is Occurrence Assessment
Identifies the non surgical procedure/s that were performed during the Surgical process.

Contains zero or more [0..*] physiologicMonitoring, where its type is Physiologic Monitoring Event
Monitor the differing in, involving, or affecting physiological factors.

Contains exactly one [1..1] preOpInrLabRequest, where its type is Lab Test Request
PreOpInr request for lab test to be performed

Contains exactly one [1..1] relatedCase, where its type is Surgical Event
The related surgical event for the current surgical event for the Patient.

Contains zero or more [0..*] restraintPosition, where its type is Restraint Position Event
An instrument or a means of restraint to prevent the infliction of harm to self or others, such as a straightjacket.

Contains zero or more [0..*] skinPrep, where its type is Skin Prep Event
The act of preparing the patient's operative site by washing the site with a disinfectant agent.
Contains exactly one [1..1] surgeon, where its type is Primary Performer

Contains exactly one [1..1] surgeryCategory, where its type is Surgeon Category
Identifies the category of the surgeon.
Contains zero or more [0..*] surgeryPatientMovement, where its type is Surgery Patient Movement

Contains exactly one [1..1] surgicalSpecialty, where its type is Surgical Specialty
This is the surgical specialty credited for doing this operative procedure. Many reports, including the Annual Report of Surgical Procedures, are sorted by the surgical specialty

Contains zero or more [0..*] tourniquet, where its type is Tourniquet Event
A device, typically a tightly encircling bandage, used to check bleeding by temporarily stopping the flow of blood through a large artery in a limb.

Contains zero or more [0..*] treatment, where its type is Treatment
Administration or application of remedies to a patient or for a disease or an injury; medicinal or surgical management; therapy.

Contains at least one [1..*] verification, where its type is Verification
Contains dates that verifications were completed.
Contains zero or one [0..1] verifier, where its type is Verifier
Extends Clinical Service

Contains exactly one [1..1] clinicalServceId with data type Id
Unique Identifier for this Clinical service .

Contains exactly one [1..1] typeOfService with data type Code
Clinical Speciality ID

Contains exactly one [1..1] id with data type Id
Unique Identifier for this surgical event.

Contains exactly one [1..1] isNonORSurgicalProcedure with data type Boolean
Indicates whether the case is a non surgical event. Like values are yes, no

Contains exactly one [1..1] preOpInrDate with data type Point In Time
This is the date that the preoperative INR was performed.

Contains exactly one [1..1] severityLevel with data type Code
Codes that identify the degree of severity of the surgical procedure.

Contains exactly one [1..1] status with data type Code
The value specifying the state of this patient surgical encounter (based on the RIM Act class state machine), for example, active, aborted, completed

Contains exactly one [1..1] supervisionLevel with data type Code
Indicates the highest level of supervision of the anesthesiology staff supervisor. Suggested include Staff Assisting Resident.

Contains exactly one [1..1] surgeryDuration with data type Time Interval
Contains the duration (date/time) of the Surgical Event.

Contains exactly one [1..1] surgeryType with data type Code
Contains Code Set that identifies the type of Surgery. like Heart, Onocology.
Contains zero or one [0..1] clinicalProcedureRecord, where its type is Clinical Procedure Record

Contains at least one [1..*] anesthesia, where its type is Anesthesia Event
The loss of sensation and usually of consciousness without loss of vital functions artificially produced by the administration of one or more agents that block the passage of pain impulses along nerve pathways to the brain Source: Merriam-Webster's Medical Dictionary, 2002 Merriam-Webster, Inc.
